item.description:
BOSTON?Sen. John McCain is heading to Boston next week as he works to replenish his campaign war chest after securing the Republican presidential nomination.


The Arizona senator will be the guest of honor Wednesday evening at the Taj Boston hotel overlooking the Public Garden.

An invitation offers a private reception with McCain in exchange for contributing $2,300, the maximum donation allowed. The price for a follow up reception is $1,000 per person.

Among the hosts are Peter Nicholas, a co-founder of Boston Scientific; Richard Egan, a co-founder of EMC Corp.; and former acting Gov. Jane Swift.

------------------------
Proposed idea:

We will stand across the street from the hotel, along the Public Garden, which happens to be the location of the 9-11 Memorial. Given the sacred location, this meetup will be billed as a "Silent Vigil for 9-11 Truth." We will make an extra effort to be polite and respectiful, even if people treat us disrespectfully.
To maximize our impact, we will standardlize our appearance for this vigil, with everyone using the black and white 9-11 Truth Now signs (which will be provided by the meetup organizers.)

Given that McCain is a terrible war hawk, we will likely cross paths with peace activists again. Let us continue to build bridges with the antiwar movement. Let our silent vigil serve as a mega-watt bullhorn for truth and justice.

group.name: We Are Change Boston / Boston 9/11 Truth

item.name: Big-ticket Boston fundraiser for McCain 3-12-08 evening
